question.text: A soluble clotting factor that is made insoluble by thrombin is _________ .

solution.text: Coagulation of blood is to prevent loss of excess blood by formation of clot or coagulum. This is a network of threads called fibrins in which dead and damaged formed elements are trapped. The mechanism is as follows: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mo>)</mo></math> An injury or trauma stimulates the platelets to release thromboplastins which activates the process of coagulation, <math><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mo>)</mo></math> Thromboplastins help in formation of the enzyme complex thrombokinase and this begins the cascade process. <math><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>)</mo></math> Thrombokinase converts inactive protein prothrombin present in the plasma into thrombin. <math><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mo>)</mo></math> Thrombin converts soluble fibrinogen into insoluble fibrin. This is done with the help of Calcium ions. <math><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mo>)</mo></math> Fibrin forms a network of threads which trap the formed elements and finally forms a clot.
